A very nice game from Valve; the story is amazing, the gameplay is interesting, and the dialogue is rather hilarious at times. Even now, the graphics would be considered very good. The gameplay is considerably longer than the first title, however at times the puzzles don't seem to have any solution, and co-op refused to work for me; regardless, it is one of the best games I've ever played.

Likely one of the funniest, cleverest puzzle games I've ever played, the pitch-black humor really suited the tone of the game as a whole, and I felt the puzzles were also incredibly well-designed and polished, I found that when I got stucjk it was usually due to my own failings and not the failing of the dev team.

I would recommend playing through a few times, as some of the humor cannot be fully appreciated with a single playthrough.

Portal 2 m'a littéralment scotché, c'est simple, j'ajoute ce jeu au top 5 des meilleurs jeu auxquels j'ai jamais joué. Oui, je pense qu'on peut déjà parler d'un jeu culte, unique.

Portal 2 es un FPS bastante poco común, es un juego en el que no vas a disparar a terroristas rusos, ni a monstruos, no te preocuparas por balas, tu salud ni de cuantas granadas te quedan. Portal 2 es un FPS que carece de todo eso. Pero no es algo que necesite para ser un buen FPS. Sin contar muchos detalles diré que eres una sujeto de pruebas (la misma del primer juego) y tienes que encontrar la forma de salir de las instalaciones guiado por Weathley... No diré mas, el juego en sí es todo historia y con solo contar el principio ya es un Spoiler, y ademas, es necesario jugar el primer juego para entender el principio de este. Pero sin embargo es un juego bastante simpático, los personajes, los entornos, todo encaja perfectamente para ofrecer una experiencia estupenda.

This game is obviously made for kids. There is a lot of feminazi bullshit in this one. Not to mention the main character is a half-blood/quadroon/octaroon African-American Mestizo woman. However, "white guilt" induced male bashing is not as prevalent as in Ubisoft's videogame with a working title "12 Years A Slave: The Game" (also known simply as "A's C: Liberation"). It's way worse than the original, especially in terms of music and sound design. Story became way more predictable as well. Uhm... I give this game 6/10. I think this game worth playing once, probably. If you have very... VERY (!) low standards when it comes to gaming. It is certainly not a good game by Valve's own self-set standards.

A game with a great story that follows on from Portal 1, the sinister GLaDOS will have you sliding, jumping and using portals through all sorts of things to get past each task. As you play you will get cheeky remarks from GLaDOS and even silly writings on the wall that will make you smile. but it doesn’t end here; you have the ability to play as two little test robots with any friend you like (even if they play on the PlayStation you can team up with them). This will lead to a few extra hours of brain teasing fun as you discuss with your friend how to pass each obstacle.

Cons:
Frustration for the simple,
On the short side.

Pros:
Hilarious writing, voice acting,
Fun cooperative mode,
Terrific writing and voice acting adds two new memorable personalities to the Portal cast.
New environmental elements including hard light bridges and super ability gels create fresh space-time-bending twists,
Great ping system to communicate with friends.

Overall I highly recommend this game to anyone who wishes to play, even if you don't want to do story mode hitting up co-op is still worth it.
I'm learning what a terrible person I am.

Вторая часть моей моей любимой серии игры. Спасибо Valve. Что же насчет игры, так это надолго. Игра очень интересная и непосредственная. Понравилось проходить уровни. Свободно проходишь игру не задумываясь ни о чем. Игра проходится быстро и легко.... Сначала.... Потом становится скучно, вам придется постоянно от кого то убегать и кого то боятся. И опять проходить все новые и новые уровни. Игра очень растянута. Не понравилось то, что по логике игры, даже самый преданный друг, может тебя предать не задумываясь. В общем игра очень интересная и непосредственная, но растянутая.
Hra u které musíte občas zapojit mozkovnu. Navazuje na první díl a docela se povedla. Doporučuji :)

Portal 2 is a masterpiece, a work of art that you will love for its ingenious story pop-culture, references to logical puzzles and co-op multiplayer. It's never less than a pure video game, but it's often more, and it will no doubt stand as one of the best entertainments in any medium. Portal 2's single-player campaign is superior to its predecessor in every way. It's the co-op mode, however, that makes this a must-play game, even for gamers that don't like first-person or puzzle games.
Great investment, realy enjoyed this game.
I f***ing like to use my mind if you that too or just enjoy a cute little game then what are you waiting for download it Now!!!!
The first Portal was an incredibly fun and unique gameplay experience, but Portal 2 polished that concept into one of the greatest games to ever grace PC.  A must play.

I want to make this really clear, Portal 2 is amazing. I am disappointed with the number of people who have complained because A) they think the game is to short and B) they bought DLC obviously selling 'trivial' content and C) they believe the visuals are poor.

Before I discuss those two points I want to say why I think this is game is incredible, firstly it succeeds in being a great sequel, it's added loads of new gameplay mechanics to freshen up the puzzles and gameplay and hasn't tainted the original essence of its predecessor. The production values are astounding there are huge set pieces, stunning effects and some of the best voice acting i've ever heard in a game from the cast, particularly Stephen Merchant for his excellent performance as the babbling Wheatley and Ellen McLain returns scary as ever as everyones favourite AI baddy GLADOS.

Now to comment on the three main criticisms i've seen. The singleplayer took many hours for me to play (at least 7 hours) and I haven't even touched the cooperative mode either which is sure to take several hours as well. The day 1 dlc is quite obviously not meant to "extend play" and is instead meant for novelty, also you can buy all the dlc in a bundle for about a quarter of the price than if you bought each item separately (if you still bought it and feel cheated then your too stupid to be playing this game). Finally, while the source engine is indeed quite old, even on my PC the game certainly looked impressive and those of you with more powerful computers and the people who will buy the console versions will enjoy the game looking even better.

In conclusion, Portal 2 is a must buy, a certain contender for game of the year, the game is smart, clever, well designed and a joy to play and I highly recommend picking it up but please if you haven't already please play the first game because it makes the experience that much better.

P.S. The ending is a great one, I can't believe some people didn't like it, It will leave you wanting more is all i'm going to say
This game is a Must.

Oh man. I got Portal 2 a few months ago, and the first time I played it... I was just amazed. This game is and excellent mix and puzzles, along with a funny and zany cast of characters that are bound to have you cracking up and really feel relateable. The story is really something. I never played the first game, but the sequel made me want to play it. GLaDOS is back and as sarcastic as ever, along with Wheatley, the funny recordings of Cave Johnson, and a whole lot of others.

So far, this is Valve's best game series so far for me. Unless Half Life is as great, but I'm gonna have to play that as well.

In all fairness, Portal 2 is an excellent adventure filled with robots, explosions and a lot of heart that makes you feel something inside.

So hug your Companion Cube tight, take control of Chell and get ready to think with portals.

Dear Children: If you want to play fun perplexing problems on the best engine ever created, while engaging in one of the best and most touching story lines of all time, then this game is for you. 

Dear Parents: If you want your children to be learn problems solving skills, and perserverance not to give up, while having loads of fun (play co-op with them), then this game is for you and your family. Did i mention that there is no human violence?

Obra maestra. No encuentro mejor manera de definirlo. Juego que tenía la dificil misión de superar a una primera parte que fué juego del año y premio a la innovación, y que había puesto el listón muy muy alto.

SInceramente, supera con creces a Portal en todas las facetas del juego. Unos gráficos impresionantes; puzzles desafiantes con la incluson de nuevos factores como líquidos o láseres; un argumento interesante, vibrante y soprendente. Además incluye un montón de variantes como el modo cooperativo y un gran feedback por parte de la comunidad con multitud de mapas.

Un juego imprescindible en la biblioteca de cualquier gamer.

Portal 2 aprofunda a diversão de Portal 1. A história agora tem bem mais envergadura e o jogo é longo o suficiente. Jogabilidade muito fluida. O multiplayer é uma diversão à parte. Não foi a toa que ganhou o prêmio de melhor multiplayer de 2012. Os puzzles só serão resolvidos mediante um esforço conjunto. Não é possível passar as salas sozinho e as vezes o outro jogador tem uma perspectiva que vc não tem. O jogo já é genial por si, mas essa interação do multiplayer num jogo de gênero puzzle foi realmente inovadora. Estou ancioso por uma continuação da franquia.

Clearly the smartest game I've ever played! A briliant story, characters that last in our memories forever, the BGM fits perfectly and isn't disturbing you. If you love puzzle game, this one will blow your mind! Almost no limits but physics and imagination. The Co-Op makes this game even better, and you also should try the community test chambers. You'll never get bored in this game. You can create your own "level" (test chambers), try them and submit to the community. Seriously, once you'll try it, you won't regret it!
